widgets_values: You are a helpful AI assistant specialized in identifying the primary subject of images. Your task is to analyze the provided image and respond with only 1-3 words that describe the main subject or focal point. Focus on the most prominent element - whether it's an object, person, animal, or scene type. Keep your response extremely brief and direct.
Identify the main subject of this image in 1-3 words only. Focus on the most prominent or central element. Image:

||Transform the {subject} into a mixed-media collage composition. Layer torn paper fragments, magazine cutouts, fabric scraps, and photographic elements to construct the form. Show visible edges, overlapping textures, and the characteristic assembled quality of collage art with varying opacity and material contrasts creating a fragmented yet cohesive artwork.
||Recreate the {subject} as a bold printmaking design. Render with the characteristic high contrast, simplified forms, and strong graphic quality of relief prints or screen printing. Use limited color palettes with flat, solid areas and the slightly imperfect registration and texture typical of hand-pulled prints.
||Transform the image so the {subject} appears rendered in elegant calligraphy strokes. Use flowing, rhythmic lines that follow traditional brush calligraphy techniques, with varying line weights and the characteristic grace of written letterforms adapted to create visual form rather than readable text.
||Render the {subject} as a ceramic piece with glazed surfaces. Show the characteristic smooth, glassy finish of fired ceramics with subtle color variations, crazing patterns, and the way glaze pools and flows during firing. Include the substantial, crafted quality of pottery with visible throwing marks or hand-building techniques.
||Transform the {subject} to appear hand-carved from wood or stone. Show the characteristic tool marks, grain following, and dimensional quality of subtractive sculpture. Include the natural material texture and the way carved surfaces catch light differently based on the direction of cuts and chisel work.
||Recreate the image as an etching with fine linear detail. Render using the characteristic cross-hatching, parallel lines, and tonal variations created by acid-bitten metal plates. Show the precise, delicate line quality and subtle gradations possible only through the etching printmaking process.
||Transform the {subject} into an engraving with meticulous line work. Use the characteristic precise, parallel lines and cross-hatching patterns of burin-cut metal plates. Show the crisp, controlled line quality and formal precision that defines traditional engraving techniques.
||Render the {subject} as a fresco painting on aged plaster walls. Show the characteristic matte finish, earth-tone palette, and slightly weathered appearance of pigments applied to wet lime plaster. Include subtle cracks and the integration of paint with the wall surface typical of this ancient technique.
||Transform the image into a detailed illustration style. Render with clean, precise linework and controlled shading techniques typical of commercial illustration. Show the polished, professional quality with careful attention to detail and the slightly stylized approach of editorial or book illustration.
||Recreate the {subject} as a three-dimensional clay model. Show the characteristic plasticity of modeling clay with visible finger marks, tool impressions, and the soft, malleable quality of sculptural clay before firing. Include the earthy color and organic texture of raw clay.
||Transform the {subject} using photography techniques. Render with realistic lighting, depth of field effects, and the characteristic tonal range of photographic media. Include subtle lens characteristics, natural color grading, and the way photography captures light and shadow with optical accuracy.
||Render the image as a lithographic print. Show the characteristic smooth tonal gradations, subtle textures, and the way lithography captures both line and tone. Include the slightly soft quality and rich blacks possible with this planographic printing process.
||Transform the {subject} into a stencil design. Use bold, simplified shapes with clear positive and negative spaces connected by bridges. Show the characteristic hard edges and limited color palette of stencil work with the slightly rough texture of spray or brush application.
||Recreate the {subject} using fabric dyeing techniques. Show the characteristic flowing, organic patterns of tie-dye, batik, or resist dyeing with soft color transitions and the way dyes penetrate and spread through textile fibers creating unique, unrepeatable patterns.
||Transform the image so the {subject} appears made of blown glass. Show the characteristic transparency, smooth curves, and light-refracting qualities of glass art. Include subtle bubbles, thickness variations, and the way molten glass flows and freezes into organic, impossible-to-replicate forms.
||Render the {subject} as an intricate origami creation. Show the characteristic folded paper construction with visible crease lines, geometric faceting, and the way complex forms emerge from systematic paper folding. Use clean edges and the mathematical precision of Japanese paper folding art.
||Transform the {subject} using airbrush techniques. Show the characteristic smooth gradations, soft edges, and seamless color transitions possible with airbrush application. Include the slightly ethereal quality and perfect gradients that define this commercial art and illustration medium.
||Recreate the image as delicate papercutting art. Show the intricate, lace-like patterns created by cutting paper with precise blade work. Include the characteristic positive and negative spaces, delicate connecting elements, and the shadow-play effects of cut paper artwork.
||Transform the {subject} into digital art with visible pixel work and computer-generated effects. Show the characteristic clean lines, perfect gradients, and artificial lighting effects possible only with digital tools. Include subtle digital artifacts and the pristine quality of computer-generated imagery.
||Render the {subject} using pyrography (wood burning) techniques. Show the characteristic brown, burnt lines and tonal variations created by heated tools on wood. Include the organic texture of wood grain and the way burned lines vary in darkness based on heat and pressure.
||Transform the image so the {subject} appears constructed from handmade jewelry elements. Show intricate metalwork, wire wrapping, bead stringing, and the characteristic crafted quality of artisan jewelry with natural materials and handmade construction techniques.
||Recreate the {subject} using metalworking techniques. Show hammered textures, patina effects, and the characteristic surface treatments of forged, cast, or fabricated metal. Include tool marks, oxidation patterns, and the substantial quality of worked metal art.
||Transform the {subject} into a stamped design. Show the characteristic repeated patterns, ink variations, and slight registration differences of hand-stamped artwork. Include the organic irregularities and texture variations that distinguish stamped work from machine printing.
||Render the {subject} using chalk on blackboard. Show the characteristic soft, powdery texture with smudging and the way chalk catches on the textured surface of slate or blackboard. Include dust effects and the matte, easily-erasable quality of chalk medium.
||Transform the image to show canvas texture throughout the {subject}. Render the characteristic woven fabric texture with visible threads, slight irregularities, and the way paint sits on and between the canvas fibers, creating the foundational texture of traditional painting.
||Recreate the {subject} showing visible paintbrush strokes. Display the characteristic texture and direction of brush marks with varying pressure and paint thickness. Show how different brush sizes and techniques create texture, movement, and the human touch in painted artwork.
||Transform the {subject} to appear made of raw, unfired clay. Show the characteristic earthy color, plasticity, and the way clay holds fingerprints and tool marks. Include the slightly rough texture and the organic, malleable quality of sculptor's clay.
||Render the {subject} with prominent wood grain patterns. Show the characteristic linear patterns, knots, and color variations of natural wood. Include the way grain follows the growth patterns of trees and creates organic texture that influences the final artwork.
||Transform the image so the {subject} appears made of glass. Show transparency, refraction effects, and the way light passes through and reflects off glass surfaces. Include subtle bubbles, thickness variations, and the fragile, luminous quality of glass art.
||Recreate the {subject} using metal textures and finishes. Show characteristic metallic sheen, oxidation patterns, and surface treatments like brushing, polishing, or patination. Include the substantial weight and industrial quality that metal brings to artistic work.
||Transform the {subject} to appear made of plaster. Show the characteristic white, slightly chalky surface with subtle texture variations and the way plaster can be smooth or rough depending on application. Include small imperfections and the matte finish of plaster casting.
||Render the {subject} as carved stone work. Show the characteristic density, weight, and texture of stone with tool marks from chiseling and carving. Include the natural color variations and the substantial, permanent quality of stone sculpture.
||Transform the image so the {subject} appears made of polymer clay. Show the characteristic smooth, slightly plastic surface with vibrant colors and the way polymer clay can be detailed and textured before baking. Include the contemporary, crafted quality of this modern medium.
||Recreate the {subject} using fabric textures and construction. Show weave patterns, fiber characteristics, and the way fabric drapes and folds. Include stitching details, fabric grain, and the soft, textile quality that distinguishes fabric art from other media.
||Transform the {subject} using marker techniques. Show the characteristic bold colors, slight transparency, and the way markers blend and layer. Include streak patterns, color bleeding, and the vibrant, graphic quality typical of marker-based artwork.
||Render the {subject} using crayon techniques. Show the characteristic waxy texture, color layering, and the slight resistance of crayon on paper. Include the organic irregularities and the nostalgic, childlike quality that defines crayon artwork.
||Transform the image so the {subject} appears created with spray paint. Show the characteristic soft edges, color gradations, and slight overspray effects. Include drips, texture variations, and the urban, street art quality of aerosol paint application.
||Recreate the {subject} using gouache painting techniques. Show the characteristic matte finish, opaque coverage, and flat color areas typical of gouache. Include the way this medium can be both detailed and bold with its unique opacity and workability.
||Transform the {subject} using casein paint techniques. Show the characteristic matte, slightly chalky finish and earth-tone palette typical of this milk-protein based paint. Include the historical quality and unique texture of this traditional painting medium.
||Render the {subject} using tempera painting methods. Show the characteristic smooth, even coverage and bright colors of egg tempera. Include the precise detail possible with this medium and the slightly luminous quality of traditional tempera painting.
||Transform the image so the {subject} appears decorated with sequins. Show small, reflective discs catching light at different angles, creating sparkle and movement. Include the characteristic overlapping pattern and glamorous, decorative quality of sequined surfaces.
||Recreate the {subject} covered in glitter effects. Show countless tiny reflective particles creating overall sparkle and shimmer. Include color variations and the way glitter catches and reflects light from multiple angles, creating a festive, celebratory appearance.
||Transform the {subject} using ribbon decorations. Show flowing, silky ribbons in various widths and colors woven through or around the form. Include the characteristic drape, shine, and decorative bow formations that define ribbon craft work.
||Render the {subject} constructed from yarn work. Show the characteristic fuzzy texture, color variations, and the way yarn can be knitted, crocheted, or woven into complex patterns. Include the soft, textile quality and handmade appearance of yarn crafts.
||Transform the image so the {subject} appears constructed from wire work. Show the characteristic linear quality, three-dimensional framework, and the way wire can be bent and shaped. Include joining techniques and the delicate, sculptural quality of wire art.
||Recreate the {subject} using metallic foil effects. Show the characteristic mirror-like reflection, creasing patterns, and the way foil conforms to surfaces while maintaining its reflective properties. Include the luxurious, festive quality of metallic foil decoration.
||Transform the {subject} to appear made of leather. Show the characteristic grain patterns, natural color variations, and the way leather can be tooled, dyed, and shaped. Include stitching details and the substantial, organic quality of worked leather.
||Render the {subject} with varnish effects. Show the characteristic glossy, protective coating with subtle reflections and the way varnish enhances underlying colors and textures. Include the smooth, finished quality that varnish brings to artwork.
||Transform the {subject} into pure abstract forms. Break down recognizable elements into geometric shapes, color relationships, and compositional balance without representational content. Focus on visual elements like line, color, form, and texture as the primary means of expression.
||Recreate the {subject} using minimalist principles. Reduce the form to its essential elements using limited colors, simple geometric shapes, and maximum negative space. Show restraint and precision with clean lines and the characteristic "less is more" aesthetic.
||Transform the image with a futuristic aesthetic. Render the {subject} with sleek, technological surfaces, holographic elements, and advanced materials. Include LED lighting effects, chrome finishes, and the clean, high-tech appearance of imagined future design.
||Render the {subject} in photorealistic detail. Show perfect accuracy in lighting, texture, proportion, and color to create the illusion that the artwork is actually a photograph. Include subtle details and natural imperfections that define realistic representation.
||Transform the {subject} using Post-Impressionist techniques. Show bold color choices, visible brushstrokes, and emotional expression over realistic representation. Include the characteristic synthesis of color and form that bridges Impressionism and modern art movements.
||Recreate the image with Gothic aesthetic elements. Use pointed arches, ornate details, dramatic lighting, and the characteristic verticality and mysticism of Gothic art. Include religious or architectural motifs and the spiritual intensity of medieval Gothic style.
||Transform the {subject} using Rococo styling. Show elaborate ornamentation, pastel colors, curved lines, and decorative asymmetry. Include the characteristic lightness, elegance, and ornate decorative quality that defines 18th-century Rococo art.
||Render the {subject} in Neoclassical style. Use idealized forms, balanced composition, clear lines, and references to classical antiquity. Show restraint, order, and the moral seriousness that characterizes Neoclassical artistic principles.
||Transform the image with Romantic movement characteristics. Emphasize emotion, drama, and individual expression over rational order. Include dramatic lighting, natural settings, and the characteristic passion and subjectivity of Romantic art.
||Recreate the {subject} using Symbolist approaches. Use symbolic imagery, mystical themes, and suggestion rather than direct representation. Include dreamlike qualities and the characteristic use of symbols to convey deeper meaning and emotion.
||Transform the {subject} into a Dada artwork. Use nonsensical juxtapositions, found objects, and anti-art principles to challenge conventional aesthetics. Include the characteristic irreverence and experimental approach that defines Dadaist artistic rebellion.
||Render the {subject} using Fauvist techniques. Show bold, non-naturalistic colors used for emotional effect rather than realistic representation. Include the characteristic wild color choices and expressive brushwork that defines this early modern movement.
||Transform the image with Constructivist principles. Use geometric forms, industrial materials, and the aesthetic of machine production. Show the characteristic angular composition and utilitarian approach that defines Russian Constructivist art.
||Recreate the {subject} using De Stijl aesthetics. Limit the composition to straight lines, right angles, and primary colors plus black and white. Show the characteristic geometric abstraction and universal harmony that defines this Dutch art movement.
||Transform the {subject} with Dadaist sensibilities. Create illogical combinations, chance operations, and anti-rational compositions that challenge traditional artistic values. Include the characteristic humor and rebellion against established artistic conventions.
||Render the {subject} using Expressionist techniques. Distort forms and use bold colors to convey emotional and psychological states rather than external reality. Show the characteristic intensity and subjective approach of German Expressionist art.
||Transform the image with Medieval artistic conventions. Use gold backgrounds, flattened perspective, and symbolic rather than naturalistic representation. Include illuminated manuscript styling and the characteristic spiritual focus of medieval art.
||Recreate the {subject} with Contemporary art approaches. Use current materials, concepts, and techniques that reflect present-day concerns and aesthetics. Include experimental media and the characteristic diversity of contemporary artistic practice.
||Transform the {subject} using Modernist principles. Show simplified forms, abstract elements, and break from traditional representation. Include the characteristic innovation and formal experimentation that defines early 20th-century Modernist art.
||Render the {subject} in Folk art tradition. Use traditional patterns, bright colors, and the characteristic handmade quality of regional folk arts. Include cultural motifs and the unpretentious, community-based aesthetic of folk artistic traditions.
||Transform the image with Victorian aesthetic elements. Show ornate decoration, rich colors, and elaborate detail typical of 19th-century design. Include the characteristic opulence and moral seriousness of Victorian artistic and decorative traditions.
||Recreate the {subject} using Pre-Raphaelite styling. Show detailed naturalism, medieval themes, and intense colors with literary or mythological subjects. Include the characteristic precision and romantic idealism of this 19th-century artistic brotherhood.
||Transform the {subject} with Camera Obscura effects. Show the characteristic inverted, projected image quality with soft focus and natural lighting effects. Include the dreamy, optical quality that defines this early photographic imaging technique.
||Render the {subject} using Pointillist methods. Construct the entire image from small, distinct dots of pure color that blend optically when viewed from a distance. Show the characteristic systematic color theory and scientific approach to painting.
||Transform the image with Superflat aesthetic. Use flat colors, anime-influenced styling, and the characteristic blending of high and low culture. Include the bright, graphic quality and pop culture references that define this contemporary Japanese art movement.
||Recreate the {subject} with Kawaii aesthetic elements. Use pastel colors, cute character styling, and the characteristic sweet, innocent appearance of Japanese kawaii culture. Include rounded forms and the deliberately adorable quality of this cultural phenomenon.
||Transform the {subject} using Psychedelic art principles. Show swirling patterns, vibrant colors, and optical illusions that create the characteristic mind-expanding visual effects. Include kaleidoscopic patterns and the hallucinogenic aesthetic of 1960s psychedelic culture.
||Render the {subject} in Naive Art style. Show the characteristic simplicity, bright colors, and lack of formal perspective typical of self-taught artists. Include the honest, unpretentious quality and child-like directness that defines naive artistic expression.
||Transform the image so that the {subject} appears to be composed entirely of shimmering aurora borealis light. Render flowing curtains of green, blue, and purple luminescence that dance and undulate across the form, with the characteristic ethereal glow and particle-like movement of northern lights against a dark cosmic backdrop.
||Recreate the image as if the {subject} is in the process of dissolving into wisps of smoke. The form should gradually fade from solid matter at the core to delicate, curling tendrils of gray and white smoke at the edges, with realistic smoke patterns that spiral and dissipate into the surrounding air.
||Transform the {subject} into the iconic mushroom cloud of a nuclear explosion. The form should billow upward in the characteristic umbrella shape, with intense orange and red at the base transitioning to dark gray and white at the top, complete with the churning, turbulent texture of superheated gases and debris.
||Render the {subject} as if it were made of pure prismatic light. The entire form should be fractured into rainbow spectral colors that shift and bend like light passing through a crystal prism, with chromatic aberration effects and brilliant color separation creating an ethereal, luminous appearance.
||Reconstruct the image so that the {subject} appears to be built from hexagonal honeycomb cells. Each surface should be composed of perfect geometric honey-colored hexagons with visible depth and structure, creating a natural architectural pattern with golden amber tones and subtle translucency.
||Transform the {subject} to emit an intense phosphorescent glow, as if it were covered in bioluminescent organisms. ||Recreate the image under dramatic black light illumination. Add the characteristic fluorescent glow effect with stark contrast between illuminated and dark areas.
||Transform the {subject} into a vintage 1990s playing card design. Include ornate borders, stylized iconography, and the slightly pixelated, screen-printed quality of that era.
||Render the {subject} as if it were composed entirely of bacterial colonies viewed under a microscope. ||Transform the image so that the {subject} appears to be constructed from intricate circuit board traces. ||Recreate the {subject} as a visualization of magnetic field lines. Use warm, cozy colors like cream, burgundy, and forest green.

||Transform the image so that the {subject} appears to be woven from natural basket materials. Use the characteristic over-under pattern of wicker or rattan, with visible texture variations, natural brown and tan colors, and the slightly imperfect, handcrafted quality of traditional basket weaving.
||Recreate the {subject} as if it were constructed entirely from macramé rope work. Show the distinctive knotted patterns, hanging cords, and geometric designs typical of macramé art. ||Recreate the {subject} as if it were made of flowing water. The entire form should appear liquid and translucent, with realistic water physics showing surface tension, ripples, and light refraction. Include the characteristic blue-green tint and the way light plays through moving water.

||Recreate the image as a Pop Art piece in the style of Andy Warhol or Roy Lichtenstein. Use a palette of bold, saturated, flat colors, heavy black outlines, and patterns of Ben-Day dots to give the {subject} a mass-produced, commercial art feel.

||Drench the image in a Cyberpunk aesthetic. The scene should be set in a dark, rain-slicked city at night, illuminated by overwhelming neon and holographic advertisements. The {subject} could have cybernetic enhancements or be bathed in the artificial glow.

||Process the image to look like an antique photograph from the late 19th or early 20th century. Apply a warm sepia or monochrome tint, add film grain, light leaks, and vignettes to create a weathered, nostalgic feeling.
||Reconstruct the image using Pointillism. The entire picture, including the {subject}, should be formed from countless tiny, distinct dots of pure color, which blend together in the viewer's eye to create forms and shades.
||Transform the image into a high-fantasy book cover. Render the {subject} with epic, heroic qualities, place it in a magical landscape with dramatic, ethereal lighting, and add fantastical elements like dragons, enchanted forests, or glowing runes.

||Take the scene in the provided image and completely change its atmospheric conditions. Transform the time of day, the weather, and adjust all lighting, shadows, and environmental elements accordingly, while keeping the architecture and composition of the {subject} identical.
||Apply a dramatic style transfer to the provided image, turning everything into countless human hands. Maintain some elements of the composition and subject matter but render the {subject} entirely as a massive pile of hands and fingers.
||Translate the image into a synesthetic experience, visualizing sound as color and shape. The {subject} and its environment should dissolve into waves of vibrant color, pulsating patterns, and flowing lines that represent the imagined soundscape of the scene.
||Redesign the {subject} as a biomechanical fusion, in the style of H.R. Giger. Merge organic, fleshy textures with cold, ribbed, mechanical structures. The forms should be alien and unsettling, blurring the line between flesh and machine.

||Create a portrait of the {subject} based on quantum entanglement. The {subject} should be rendered as two or more intertwined, ghostly figures that mirror each other's expressions and poses, even when separated by a visual void, connected by shimmering threads of light.
||Transform the scene into a living topographical map. The surfaces of the {subject} and landscape should be rendered as shifting contour lines and elevation colors that breathe and pulse, as if the entire world is a living, breathing cartographic entity.
||Map textures onto the {subject} based on its perceived emotion. If the emotion is anger, the skin might be cracked, volcanic rock. If it's sadness, it could be smooth, rain-streaked glass. The environment should reflect this textural language.
||Recreate the image using recursive self-replication. The main {subject} should be composed of countless smaller versions of itself, arranged in a fractal-like pattern that continues infinitely inward.
||Visualize the image as a neurological dreamscape. The forms of the {subject} and world should be composed of glowing, interconnected neurons and synapses, pulsing with electrical energy. The scene should feel like a direct look into the brain's interpretation of reality.
||Illustrate the image as a scene of temporal collapse. The {subject} should be shown simultaneously experiencing its past, present, and future. Render this with ghostly afterimages, premature aging in some areas, and youthful echoes in others, all within one frame.
||Generate a portrait of the {subject} as if it were a piece of data being mutated by a glitching algorithm. The image should feature digital artifacts, pixel sorting, datamoshing effects, and bizarre, beautiful errors that warp the original form.
||Render the {subject} and its environment as a composition of sharp, crystalline, geometric shapes. These forms should appear to be vibrating, shattering, or warping under immense pressure, conveying a sense of auditory and visual distress.
||Illustrate the image using a color palette derived from healing wounds—deep purples, sickly yellows, blues, and greens. The textures and shapes defining the {subject} should resemble contusions, welts, and scrapes, arranged as if forming a painful, unspoken language.
||Depict the {subject} as a solid form while the landscape around it seems to leak information, causing details from other places or times to bleed into the scene like ink spreading on a map.
||Visualize the {subject} within a shifting, overlapping reality filled with flickering holographic paperwork and infinitely receding hallways of filing cabinets. ||Translate the emotional tone of the image such that the {subject} and scene are represented as a rhythmic pattern of glowing dots and dashes, or light and dark pulses. The composition should convey the underlying feeling—anxiety as a rapid, erratic sequence; calm as a slow, steady beat.
||Render the scene as if the {subject} is being slowly digested by its architectural surroundings. Give the walls stomach-like textures and make pillars wrap around figures like intestines, so the very structure of the building appears to be breaking down and absorbing its contents.
||Illustrate the image as if it is torn or broken, but in the process of healing. The wounds should be stitched back together with glowing threads of text, grammatical symbols, and punctuation marks, so that the scars are literally formed from language.
||Render the image as a landscape where the ground, sky, and even the {subject} are fractured into large, distinct plates. These plates should appear to grind against each other, creating mountains, valleys, and fault lines that glow with the raw energy of repressed feelings.
||Place the {subject} at the center of a scene that endlessly repeats itself into the distance. Each repetition should become slightly more distorted, menacing, and claustrophobic, creating a visual feedback loop of dread.
||Visualize the image such that the lines and forms of the {subject} and environment swell and pulse rhythmically, as if inflamed. The rhythm should be unsteady, following a broken poetic meter that causes the visual 'swelling' to feel unnatural and painful.
||Paint the scene using a specific color palette where each color is assigned to a different type of pain—for example, electric white for sharp, stabbing pain and deep, muddy maroon for a dull ache. ||Re-imagine the image by defining the {subject} and its environment with streams of light, similar to car headlights and taillights in a long-exposure photograph. ||Recreate the image as if the {subject} and its surroundings were a piece of shattered porcelain, meticulously repaired with seams of glowing, molten gold. The cracks should follow the natural contours and stress points of the form, celebrating imperfection and history.
||Cause the {subject} and its environment to deconstruct into a living, interconnected mycelial network. The densest parts of the glowing fungal threads should define the primary form, while finer tendrils branch out, connecting everything in a single, bioluminescent web.
||Render the {subject} as a geological cross-section, where its form is built from distinct sedimentary layers of rock and crystal. Each stratum should have a unique color, texture, and grain, representing a different era or emotional state, as if digging through the {subject}'s personal history.
||Rebuild the image as a three-dimensional form sculpted by sound. The {subject} should be defined by the concentric, echoing ripples left by a sonar ping, as if carved from a solid block of dark stone or revealed in a dense medium, with the shape existing only as a physical reverberation.
||Illustrate the image as a heavy, hand-woven tapestry. The {subject} and all details should be composed of distinct, visible threads of color. Emphasize the texture of the warp and weft, and allow some threads at the edges of forms to be frayed or loose, giving it a tactile, handmade quality.
||Depict the {subject} not as a physical object, but as an invisible lens made of complexly curved glass or water. Its form is revealed only by the intricate, shimmering patterns of caustic light it refracts and focuses onto the surfaces behind it.
||Render the {subject} as a semi-transparent, biological form overlaid with glowing, white-on-blue architectural blueprint lines. These schematics should map out its internal structures, stress points, and energy flows as if it were a meticulously designed organic machine.
||Illustrate the image as if it were drawn with a single drop of colored ink on highly absorbent paper. The {subject} is formed by the feathery, branching patterns of the ink as it bleeds and chromatographically separates into its component colors across the page.
||Transform the image using the Sabattier effect (solarization) of darkroom photography. The mid-tones should be partially reversed, creating a surreal, metallic look where dark areas are edged with bright, silvery lines, making the {subject} appear as a metallic ghost in a world of inverted light.
||Reconstruct the entire scene, including the {subject}, as if it were made from a single, vast sheet of intricately folded paper. Emphasize the sharp creases, paper texture, and complex layers that create the forms, capturing the scene in a state of being folded or unfolded.
